Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class SourceDocument

java.lang.Object
javax.swing.text.AbstractDocument
javax.swing.text.PlainDocument
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.SourceDocument
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Document
public class SourceDocument extends PlainDocument
A document that represents the content of a source file in a JSourceCodeEditor. Note that unlike most document classes, this class provides built-in undo and redo support.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • getTabWidth

      public int getTabWidth()
      Returns the tab size of the document. This is a convenience that reads the tab size from the document properties. The default tab size is 4.
      Returns:
      the document tab size
      See Also:
      PlainDocument.tabSizeAttribute

    • getTokenizer

      public Tokenizer getTokenizer()
      Returns the tokenizer used to style the document contents by breaking it up into token streams.
      Returns:
      the tokenizer for this document, or null if none is set

    • setTokenizer

      public void setTokenizer​(Tokenizer tokenizer)
      Sets the tokenizer that will be used to style this document by breaking it up into token streams. The tokenizer may be set to null, in which case the document is displayed in a plain style. However, it is recommended that a PlainTextTokenizer be used for this purpose, as this enables support for additional features such as Highlighters and MarginNotes.
      Parameters:
      tokenizer - the new tokenizer

    • canUndo

      public boolean canUndo()
      Returns true if an edit can be undone.
      Returns:
      true if an undo() would have an effect

    • canRedo

      public boolean canRedo()
      Returns true if an edit can be redone.
      Returns:
      true if an redo() would have an effect

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Undoes the most recent edit in the undo history, if any.

    • redo

      public void redo()
      Redoes the most recently undone edit, if any. If a sequence of undos is performed and then a regular edit occurs, all redoable edits following the last undone event are discarded and the undo history will be advanced to the point after the new edit.

    • beginCompoundEdit

      public void beginCompoundEdit()
      Starts a compound edit that can be undone in one operation. Editing command implementations can call this at the start of a command so that a sequence of edits will appear to be a single action. When this method is used, it must be paired with a call to endCompoundEdit(). To ensure this, the edit commands should be performed in a try-catch block, and the call to endCompoundEdit() placed in a finally clause: 
       doc.beginCompoundEdit();
 try {
     // ...sequence of edits...
 } finally {
     doc.endCompoundEdit();
 }

    • endCompoundEdit

      public void endCompoundEdit()
      Ends an in-progress compound edit previously started with beginCompoundEdit(). The sequence of edits since the compound edit began will be collected into a group that will be undone and redone as a single edit.

      Compound edits can be safely nested.

    • clearUndoHistory

      public void clearUndoHistory()
      Clears the history of undoable edits.

      public void insertString​(int offs, String str, AttributeSet a) throws BadLocationException
      Inserts some content into the document.
      Specified by:
      insertString in interface Document
      Overrides:
      insertString in class PlainDocument
      Parameters:

      str - the string to insert; does nothing with null/empty strings
      a - the attributes for the inserted content; this should be null
      Throws:
      BadLocationException - the given insert position is not a valid position within the document
